author: Chelsey Dulaney
title: Turkey’s Currency Meltdown in 6 Charts - MoneyBeat - WSJ
text: Turkey’s lira fell as much as 5% on Wednesday, extending a dramatic slide that has brought the currency to a record low and fueled concerns about the ability of other emerging-market nations to withstand tighter U.S. monetary policy. The lira has been falling for years but the slide has accelerated since mid-April, pressured by the resurgence WSJ City PM: Deutsche Bank Zeroes In on 10,000 Job Cuts, Europe's Opaque Trades, What to Expect from Fed Minutes
